description: In this erotic romance, Raven discovers that her girlfriend enjoys being sexually submissive, leading both women to explore their kinkier sides.

title: Lakeshire Park
author: Megan Walker
description: Walker’s debut Regency romance follows reluctant-to-love Amelia Moore’s attempts to save herself and her sister from destitution by securing a suitable husband.

title: Lost in Oaxaca
author: Jessica Winters Mireles
description: When solitary piano teacher Camille Childs’s star pupil Graciela disappears two weeks before her concert, Camille travels to Graciela’s childhood home in the mountains of Oaxaca, Mexico, to look for her, aided by Alejandro, a Zapotec man who helps Camille navigate the unfamiliar culture and find love along the way.

title: The Real Thing
author: Laney Webber
description: When Allison McDonald is catfished by a woman on a dating app, she seeks out the person whose photo the catfish used to try to protect others from being fooled, only to find that the real woman is even better than the fantasy.

title: The Last Days of Autumn
author: Donna K. Ford
description: Autumn Landers, recently diagnosed with cancer, falls in love with her live-in caregiver, Caroline Cross, despite the small amount of time she has left to live.

title: The Mail Order Bride
author: R. Kent
description: In this historical romance, Austin, a trans man, dreams of homesteading alone on the fringes of the wild frontier, but a troubled past, a deadly gunslinger, and a mail order bride who claims he sent for her, complicate his plans.

title: Bane’s Choice
author: Alyssa Day
description: This vampiric paranormal romance is the first in a new series from bestseller Day. 100,000-copy announced first printing.

title: Siri, Who Am I?
author: Sam Tschida
description: A millennial woman with amnesia must piece together her identity using clues on her Instagram account, which leads her to a cute house sitter named Max, a mysterious French billionaire named JP, and the startling discovery that maybe she wasn’t a good person.

title: The Weekend Wedding Assistant
author: Rachel Gladstone
description: Julia Holmes’s fiancé is struck and killed by lightning in this dark romantic comedy. Returning to her planned wedding venue in search of closure, Julia is offhandedly offered a job as weekend wedding assistant. Ushering four brides a weekend down the aisle forces Julia to wonder if she’ll ever find true love again.

title: That’s Not a Thing
author: Jacqueline Friedland
description: When Meredith Altman’s ex-fiancé, Wesley, returns to the states after years abroad, Meredith is torn between the man who broke her heart when their engagement ended in disaster and her new fiancé, Aaron, who helped lift her heart off the floor. Meredith’s confusion about her feelings only grows when she learns that Wesley has been diagnosed with ALS.

title: An Inconvenient Duke
author: Anna Harrington
description: A woman working for a charity for abused women falls for her late best friend’s brother, a duke who is determined to catch his sister’s killer, in the first Regency romance of Harrington’s Lords of the Armory series.

title: Rebel Wears Plaid
author: Eliza Knight
description: This series launch introduces Lady Jenny Mackintosh, willing to risk her life to help the Jacobite rebellion, and warrior Toran Fraser, hell-bent on taking down the Jacobites responsible for his mother’s death. When their paths cross, Toran falls for Jenny, not realizing she’s his enemy.

title: Boyfriend Material
author: Alexis Hall
description: Reluctantly famous Luc O’Donnell recruits respectable, successful Oliver Blackwood to be his PR boyfriend in an attempt to save his floundering reputation from scandal, but when their fake relationship starts to feel real, they’ll have to decide how far they’re willing to go.

title: The Tourist Attraction
author: Sarah Morgenthaler
description: Morgenthaler’s series opener introduces readers to Moose Springs, Alaska, where a diner owner who resents the resort visitors who frequent his restaurant falls for a kind-hearted tourist.

title: A Wedding in the Olive Garden
author: Leah Fleming
description: Sara Loveday ditches her cheating fiancé at the altar and flees to the beautiful island of Santaniki, where she sets up a wedding planning business specializing in “second time around” couples, and grows close to Griff, the manager of a nearby artists’ retreat.

title: The Honey-Don’t List
author: Christina Lauren
description: Assistants to a feuding celebrity couple are tasked with keeping the public from discovering the truth about their bosses’ rocky relationship in this romantic comedy.

title: Real Men Knit
author: Kwana Jackson
description: After Jesse Strong’s adoptive mother dies, he struggles to keep her beloved Harlem knitting shop in business with the help of his foster brothers and his childhood best friend-turned-crush.

title: Beach Read
author: Emily Henry
description: A romance writer who no longer believes in love and a literary writer stuck in a rut engage in a summer-long challenge to write—and live—outside of their comfort zones in YA author Henry’s adult debut.

title: Like Lovers Do: A Girls Trip Novel
author: Tracey Livesay
description: The second installment to Livesay’s Girls Trip series is a friends-to-lovers, fake relationship romance between an uptight surgeon and the wayward son of a medical business empire set during a scenic vacation on Martha’s Vineyard.

title: Loathe at First Sight
author: Suzanne Park
description: YA author Park’s debut rom-com, starred by PW, follows an aspiring video game designer hoping to reform the sexist gaming industry from within—and her enemies-to-lovers relationship with her boss’s nephew.

title: Written in the Stars
author: Alexandria Bellefleur
description: After straitlaced Darcy tells her brother that her disastrous date with astrologer Elle was successful, the lie spirals until the women must fake a relationship to save face.

title: Spoiler Alert
author: Olivia Dade
description: Dade delves into the world of fandom in her debut rom-com about a plus-sized cosplayer who lands a date with her celebrity crush, not realizing that he’s also her favorite fan fiction author.

title: Jane in Love
author: Rachel Givney
description: In Givney’s debut, Jane Austen accidentally time travels to the modern-day film set of Northanger Abbey. Jane befriends Sofia Wentworth, the film’s star, and falls for her handsome brother, Fred—but is a chance at love worth staying lost in time?

title: Beauty Tempts the Beast: A Sins for All Seasons Novel
author: Lorraine Heath
description: In the finale to the series, the newly penniless Althea Stanwick turns to Benedict Trewlove, nicknamed Beast, for lessons in seduction.

title: My Last Duchess
author: Eloisa James
description: revisits the Wilde family with this prequel about the unconventional courtship between single parents Hugo Wilde, Duke of Lindow, and Lady Ophelia Astley.

title: You Lucky Dog
author: Julia London
description: After a dog walker accidentally mixes up one client’s perky pup for another’s depressed hound, the owners meet to switch their pets and wind up falling in love in this rom-com from bestseller London.

title: The Roommate
author: Rosie Danan
description: Clara Wheaton’s new roommate may be easy on the eyes, but he’s a virtual stranger. When Clara goes digging for information about him online, she discovers his scandalous profession—and the revelation only brings them closer.

title: Meet You in the Middle
author: Devon Daniels
description: Love bridges the political divide in Daniels’s debut rom-com about the enemies-to-lovers relationship between a liberal Senate staffer and a conservative powerhouse in Washington, D.C.

title: The Brass Queen
author: Elizabeth Chatsworth
description: Wealthy Lady Constance Haltwhistle lives a double life as the “Brass Queen,” inventing the finest weapons in Victorian England. When Constance’s life is thrown into danger, she teams up with American spy J.F. Trusdale to save Great Britain and the world in Chatsworth’s genre-bending romance.

title: Rescue You
author: Elysia Whisler
description: Constance Morrigan signs up for a membership at Rhett Santos’s gym. Rhett, a former soldier, is prickly and has PTSD, but the alluring Constance gets past his defenses. With Constance’s dog rescue on the brink of closure, Constance sees an opportunity for the dogs to help Rhett heal.

title: The Love Scam
author: Maryjanice Davidson
description: Claire Delaney, a consumate do-gooder, tracks down wealthy ne’er-do-well Rake Tarbell in Venice, Italy, to reunite him with the daughter he never knew he had, in Davidson’s twisty contemporary rom-com.

title: A Highlander Is Coming to Town: A Highland, Georgia Novel
author: Laura Trentham
description: The singer of a touring Scottish rock band falls for a beleaguered farmer during the Christmas season in Trentham’s third rom-com set in Highland, Ga.

title: All Scot and Bothered
author: Kerrigan Byrne
description: Byrne’s second Devil You Know romance sees Lord Chief Justice Cassius Ramsey setting out to investigate London’s most notorious gaming hall, unaware that the owner is Cecilia Teague, the alluring woman he hopes to court.

title: Scandalous Secrets
author: Synithia Williams
description: Bryon Robidoux helped his good friend (and secret crush) Zoe Hammond avoid a scandal when they were in college. Now, with Bryon running for Senate, a blackmailer digs up their long-buried secrets, threatening Bryon’s career and throwing the lives of Zoe and her daughter into chaos.

title: Claiming His Bollywood Cinderella
author: Tara Pammi
description: Naina Menon meets Bollywood superstar Vikram Raawal at a masquerade ball in this contemporary romance from Pammi. Despite a rocky first meeting, the pair soon discover a passion that disproves Vikram’s cynical theory that love exists only in the movies.

title: The Wife He Needs
author: Brenda Jackson
description: CEO Garth Outlaw’s meddling sister sets him up with his employee, Regan, who has had a crush on Garth for years, by sending them on a week-long romantic getaway, in this contemporary series launch from Jackson.

title: Then There Was You
author: Mona Shroff
description: In Shroff’s sophomore contemporary romance, Daniel Bliant, a helicopter medic with demons in his past, falls for Annika Mehta, a brokenhearted kindergarten teacher who moonlights as a bartender. But will their chemistry be enough to break down their walls?

title: A Haven for Christmas
author: Patricia Davids
description: Romance tropes collide in Davids’s contemporary romance about an injured cowboy recuperating on an Amish widow’s farm at Christmas time.

title: Better Than People
author: Roan Parrish
description: Anxious pet lover Simon Burke meets grumpy children’s book author Jack Matheson, the owner of a pack of rescue animals, through a pet sharing app, in Parrish’s contemporary romance.

title: Here to Stay
author: Adriana Herrera
description: When Julia del Mar Ortiz’s company brings in consultant Rocco Quinn to help it go public, Julia has to fight to prove her worth in this enemies-to-lovers romance and series launch.

title: Once Dishonored
author: Mary Jo Putney
description: A disgraced naval officer helps a widow with a tarnished reputation of her own to clear her name of scandal and reunite with her young son amid judgmental London society and mounting dangers in Putney’s fifth Rogues Redeemed Regency romance.

title: Silver Creek Fire
author: Lindsay McKenna
description: Bestseller McKenna kicks off a new romantic suspense series with the love story between a carpenter with a traumatic past and the rancher who hires her to fix up his property, despite a series of mysterious events on the ranch.

title: Holding Out for Christmas
author: Janet Dailey
description: It’s Christmas in Branding Iron, Tex., and cowboy Conner Branch is eager to reconnect with the singer who stole his heart at last year’s Cowboy Christmas Ball.

title: Searching for Rose
author: Dana Becker
description: Journalist Avi Steinberg, writing as Becker, makes his romance debut with this romantic suspense novel about a woman’s search for her missing sister and the Amish man who comes to her rescue.

title: Fairy Godmothers Inc.
author: Saranna DeWylde
description: DeWylde introduces the small, enchanted town of Ever After, Mo., where love is the source of all magic and the town’s resident fairy godmothers take it upon themselves to play matchmakers.

title: The Love Study
author: Kris Ripper
description: An office temp with a fear of commitment agrees to go on a YouTube dating show, but instead of falling for any of the dates the show sets him up with, he develops feelings for the nonbinary host.

title: Mistletoe and Mr. Right
author: Sarah Morgenthaler
description: Lana Montgomery moves home to Moose Springs, Alaska, determined to stop the fabled “Santa Moose” from rampaging through the town’s Christmas decorations. But the tranquilizer dart meant for the moose accidentally lands in Rick Harding, a man who’s harbored feelings for Lana for years.

title: If the Boot Fits
author: Rebekah Weatherspoon
description: Weatherspoon’s second Cowboys of California romance is a contemporary Cinderella story about an aspiring screenwriter who gets a chance to attend one of Hollywood’s hottest parties where she meets—and shares a steamy encounter with—a cattle rancher turned A-List actor.

title: The Way You Hold Me
author: Elle Wright
description: Wright’s second contemporary to feature the Hollywood fixers of the Pure Talent Agency follows agent Skye Palmer as she tries to control the narrative around a client’s divorce. But when Skye’s client’s husband hires Skye’s ex to do the same, the situation gets much more complicated.

title: The Brightest Star
author: Fern Michaels
description: A small business owner struggles to hold her own against online competitors during the holiday season in this Christmas-themed romance from bestseller Michaels. 100,000-copy announced first printing.

title: Won’t Go Home Without You
author: Cheris Hodges
description: A man tries to save his failing marriage in Hodges’s second Richardson Sisters romance, set against the backdrop of the family’s historic South Carolina bed and breakfast.

title: Notorious
author: Minerva Spencer
description: Strong-willed Drusilla Clare doesn’t believe in marriage, but when she meets rakish Gabriel Marlington, she can’t deny her attraction. After a scandal leaves the pair with no choice but to marry, the unlikely duo must navigate newlywed life.

title: The Jackal, Vol. 1,
author: J.R. Ward
description: Bestseller Ward launches a new paranormal romance series, a spinoff of her Black Dagger Brotherhood books, set in a subterranean prison camp full of murderous supernatural creatures.

title: Who’s That Earl?
author: Susanna Craig
description: Craig’s Live and Let Spy series launch, starred by PW, sees Jane Quayle, an author writing under a pen name to conceal her gender, reuniting with Lt. Thomas Sutherland, the earl who has loved her for years.

title: London’s Most Elusive Earl
author: Anabelle Bryant
description: Lord Jonathan Cromford, a rakish earl who must produce an heir in order to receive his inheritance, meets Lady Caroline Nicholson, who is determined to make a respectable match—but can’t deny her attraction to Cromford—in Bryant’s fourth Midnight Secrets romance.

title: The Truth About Dukes
author: Grace Burrowes
description: In the fifth Regency romance of Burrowes’s Rogues to Riches series, a duke hoping to conceal his scandalous past through a respectable marriage, however dull that prospect may be, sets his sights on a seemingly demure lady harboring secrets of her own. 150,000-copy announced first printing.

title: The Return
author: Nicholas Sparks
description: A Navy doctor recuperates from wartime injuries in his recently deceased grandfather’s North Carolina cabin in this small town romance from bestseller Sparks. As Dr. Trevor Benson heals, he develops a connection with deputy sheriff Natalie Masterson and uncovers the truth about his grandfather’s mysterious death. 1,500,000-copy announced first printing.

title: Kiss My Cupcake
author: Helena Hunting
description: Sparring bar owners compete for business until realizing they work better together, in Hunting’s sophomore rom-com, starred by PW. 60,000-copy announced first printing.

title: A Lady’s Guide to Mischief and Mayhem
author: Manda Collins
description: Collins begins a new series of Victorian romances with this enemies-to-lovers tale of a police detective who reluctantly accepts the help of a female reporter in order to catch a killer.

title: The Gentleman and the Thief
author: Sarah M. Eden
description: Eden’s Victorian-era romance sees a well-to-do gentleman who secretly writes penny dreadfuls falling head over heels for a woman leading a double life as a music teacher by day and notorious thief by night.

title: The Aloha Spirit
author: Linda Ulleseit
description: Free-spirited Dolores searches for love in 1922 Honolulu, running away from home and straight into an abusive marriage. When Alberto, one of her husband’s relatives, helps her escape, it sparks an unexpected passion. But can Dolores learn to trust again?

title: The Holiday Detour
author: Jane Kolven
description: This holiday-themed romance features a high-strung Jewish lesbian, a nonbinary pig farmer, and the spontaneous, mishap-filled road trip that brings them together.

title: Her Lady to Love
author: Jane Walsh
description: Wallflower Honora Banfield needs a husband and asks the scandalous Jacqueline Lockhart for help in catching one, but their friendship soon turns to passion in this f/f Regency from Walsh.

title: The Magic Number
author: Natalie Gibson
description: This standalone work of erotica set in the universe of Gibson’s Witchbound series explores the world of BDSM through a powerful coven of witches who draw their magic from sexual energy.

title: Hex, Love, and Rock and Roll
author: Kat Turner
description: pairs a bumbling witch with a famous rock star whose life may be in danger from a scarab-worshipping cult, in her debut paranormal romance, the first in the Coven Daughters series.

title: Follow Me Darkly
author: Helen Hardt
description: The first in a new series of erotic romances from bestseller Hardt sees a farm girl with dreams of becoming a photographer transplanted to the big city, where she falls for a domineering billionaire with a dark side. 75,000-copy announced first printing.

title: The Rakehell of Roth
author: Amalie Howard
description: Howard follows The Beast of Bestwick with a Regency take on Sleeping Beauty about an unhappily married woman who hatches a plan to remind her husband exactly who he married.

title: Charming Falls Apart
author: Angela Terry
description: After Allison James’s perfect life falls to pieces, she decides to put herself first for once. She raids the self-help aisle of the bookstore, visits an astrologer, and tries meditation—all while flirting with the attractive owner of her neighborhood café.

title: Big Bad Wolf
author: Suleikha Snyder
description: New York City serves as a sanctuary for supernatural creatures in Snyder’s first Third Shift paranormal romance. After vigilante Joe Peluso takes down six members of a clan of criminal bear-shifters, lawyer Neha Ahluwalia comes to his defense—putting targets on both their backs.

title: The Duke’s Princess Bride
author: Amalie Howard
description: After Princess Sarani Rao’s father, an Indian maharaja, is murdered, Sarani must flee aboard the ship of the man she used to love to avoid meeting the same fate. Will reuniting with British Capt. Rhystan Huntley reignite their old flame?.

title: The Stormbringer
author: Isabel Cooper
description: introduces a world full of monsters, in this fantasy romance about a man newly awakened from a mystical sleep who teams up with a fierce female warrior to save the world from the Traitor God.

title: Montana Cowboy Christmas
author: Jane Porter
description: Rodeo star Ivy Wyckoff heads home for the holidays, where she reconnects with her ex, fellow rodeo champ Sam Wyatt, in this second installment to the Wyatt Brothers series.

title: In a Holidaze
author: Christina Lauren
description: Lauren, a pseudonymous writing duo, put a Groundhog’s Day–style spin on their holiday-themed rom-com about a hapless heroine who’s forced to relive her Christmas vacation in a disaster-filled time loop until she can finally get a mistletoe kiss from the man she loves.

title: The Raven Lady
author: Sharon Lynn Fisher
description: To ensure an alliance between the Kingdom of Ireland and the Icelandic shadow elves, Queen Isolde arranges a marriage between her cousin, Duncan, and the Elven princess, Koli, in this fantasy romance from Fisher.

title: Someone to Romance
author: Mary Balogh
description: Balogh’s eighth Wescott Regency novel follows practical Lady Jessica Archer as she sets out to find a husband, never believing she’ll fall in love—until enigmatic Gabriel Thorne, the recent inheritor of a mysterious fortune, declares his intention to court her.

title: Crazy Stupid Bromance
author: Lyssa Kay Adams
description: continues the Bromance Book Club series—about an all-male book club in which members use the lessons they learn from romance novels to improve their own love lives—with this love story between a hacktivist and the owner of a cat café.

title: Jingle All the Way
author: Debbie Macomber
description: In this Christmas romance from bestseller Macomber, a workaholic heroine avoids spending the holidays with her family by booking an Amazonian river cruise—and winds up falling for her charming tour guide.

title: Wilde Child: Wildes of Lindow Castle
author: Eloisa James
description: A straitlaced viscount vows to protect an impulsive female actor from the dangers of the theater world in James’s sixth Wildes of Lindow Castle romance.

title: Act Your Age, Eve Brown
author: Talia Hibbert
description: The finale to Hibbert’s Brown Sisters rom-com series sees chaotic Eve Brown hired as a chef at a bed and breakfast, where she finds love with the uptight owner despite a disastrous first meeting.

title: Scoundrel of My Heart
author: Lorraine Heath
description: Kicking off the Once upon a Dukedom series, Heath’s latest Regency sees a woman desperately trying to land a duke—but accidentally falling for a title-less scoundrel instead.

title: The Duke Goes Down
author: Sophie Jordan
description: launches the Duke Hunt series with this Regency-set enemies-to-lovers romance between a duke’s son, born out of wedlock, and avicar’s daughter who’ve hated each other since childhood.

title: Incense and Sensibility
author: Sonali Dev
description: continues the story of the Raje family with a third Desi-American Jane Austen retelling, this time transposing Sense and Sensibility to the world of California politics.

title: Playing the Palace
author: Paul Rudnick
description: When New York City party planner Carter Ogden meets Prince Edgar of England at one of his events, it kicks off an unlikely romance. But can their relationship survive royal pressure and public scrutiny?

title: While We Were Dating
author: Jasmine Guillory
description: turns the focus on Ben Stephens, who Guillory’s fans will recognize from The Wedding Date, for a standalone workplace romance.

title: Lizzie & Dante
author: Mary Bly
description: Historical romance maven Eloisa James makes her contemporary debut, writing as Bly, with this love story between a Shakespearean scholar and an Italian chef who meet on the island of Elba.

title: How to Save a Life
author: Eva Carter
description: .When med student Kerry Smith’s crush, Joel, goes into cardiac arrest, she and her best friend, Tim, must act fast—and the incident changes each of their lives and relationships for years to come.

title: The Wisteria Society of Lady Scoundrels
author: India Holton
description: Holton’s Victorian-era debut introduces a secret sorority of lady thieves, as one among their number finds love with a dashing assassin while she works to take down a dastardly pirate.

title: The Summer Job
author: Lizzy Dent
description: Eager to step away from her life, the heroine of Dent’s debut rom-com assumes her best friend’s identity and takes over her gig at a Scottish hotel, leading to lies, love, and mistaken identity.

title: The Layover
author: Lacie Waldon
description: Waldon debuts with a romantic comedy concerning a flight attendant and her much-hated former pilot, who reconnect in midair and wind up stranded together in a tropical paradise.

title: Murder at Sunrise Lake
author: Christine Feehan
description: Bestseller Feehan delivers a standalone romantic suspense novel with paranormal elements set in the Sierra Nevadas.

title: Hana Khan Carries On
author: Uzma Jalaluddin
description: Rival halal restaurants, family secrets, and the budding romance between a podcaster and one of her listeners feature in Jalaluddin’s sophomore rom-com.

title: It’s Been a Pleasure, Noni Blake
author: Claire Christian
description: follows bisexual people-pleaser Noni Blake as, after a painful breakup, she revisits her past relationships on a whirlwind trip through Europe. 50,000-copy announced first printing.

title: One Last Stop
author: Casey McQuiston
description: McQuiston follows her breakout Red, White, and Royal Blue with a Sapphic rom-com infused with magic. August has a crush on a woman she sees every day on the New York City subway—but what happens when she realizes that her fellow commuter is displaced from the 1970s?

title: The Little French Bridal Shop
author: Jennifer Dupee
description: When a heartbroken woman impulsively buys a wedding dress, it leads to a lie that spirals out of control until she’s planning a wedding without a groom.

title: A Duke in Time
author: Janna MacGregor
description: launches the Widows Rules series with a steamy romance set in Regency London.

title: Make Up Break Up
author: Lily Menon
description: Rival app developers go from enemies to lovers even as they compete for the same investment money in YA author Menon’s adult debut.

title: Float Plan
author: Trish Doller
description: A grieving woman attempts to take the sea voyage she planned with her late fiancé by herself—but soon realizes she can’t go it alone and hires a professional sailor to help in YA author Doller’s adult debut.

title: Follow Your Heart
author: Brenda Jackson
description: Talk-show host Victoria Madaris allows her great-grandmother to set her up with potential suitors in an attempt to resist her feelings for U.S. senator Roman Malone in this small-town contemporary. 150,000-copy announced first printing.

title: Cold Case Reopened
author: Caridad Piñeiro
description: A woman investigating her twin sister’s disappearance falls for the police detective on the case in this second Unsolved Mystery romance.

title: The Surprise Bollywood Baby
author: Tara Pammi
description: follows Claiming His Bollywood Cinderella with this story of the publicity relationship between Bollywood superstars—and what happens when a behind-the-scenes hookup leads to an all-too-real pregnancy that complicates their fake romance.

title: The Road to Rose Bend
author: Naima Simone
description: launches the Rose Bend series as a wayward daughter of the Massachusetts town returns, newly divorced and pregnant, and hits it off with the town’s grieving mayor. 150,000-copy announced first printing.

title: Knit, Purl, a Baby and a Girl
author: Hettie Bell
description: Poppy Adams turns to a knitting circle to support her through her unplanned pregnancy and falls in love with Rhiannon, the group’s leader, in this contemporary from Bell.

title: Heartless
author: Gena Showalter
description: A pro gamer receives a heart transplant that grants her mystical powers and leads her to a magical world ruled by a dangerous man who has a history with her heart’s previous owner. 600,000-copy announced first printing.

title: Best Laid Plans
author: Roan Parrish
description: follows Better than People with another contemporary, this time between a lovable grouch and his new handyman.

title: An Earl, the Girl, and a Toddler
author: Vanessa Riley
description: Riley follows A Duke, the Lady, and a Baby with this Regency about a Jamaican maid who arrives in London with amnesia. Her efforts to uncover her identity lead to unexpected love.

title: Duchess If You Dare
author: Anabelle Bryant
description: A secret sisterhood of female vigilantes plays Robin Hood in Regency England in this series launch, and one of their number must team up with a straitlaced duke to solve a mystery.

title: The Girl with Stars in Her Eyes
author: Xio Axelrod
description: A Philadelphia indie rocker on the brink of making it big is thrown back together with her ex-boyfriend when she auditions for a new band in this standalone rom-com from Axelrod.

title: Love at First
author: Kate Clayborn
description: Nora Clarke is determined to save her beloved apartment building from being sold by its new owner, Will Sterling, and is willing to sabotage the sale to do so—no matter how much chemistry she and Will share.

title: The Marriage Pass
author: Briana Cole
description: Cole launches a new series with this story of a couple who open their marriage—and in so doing lock themselves into a cycle of complicated mind games.

title: Summer in the City
author: Lori Wilde, Priscilla Oliveras, and Sarah Skilton
description: The three connected rom-com novellas in this anthology take place during a New York City power outage as three friends find themselves in unexpected situations with the men of their dreams.

title: The Virgin Who Vindicated Lord Darlington
author: Anna Bradley
description: Celia Gilchrist goes undercover as a governess to investigate the murder of a Marquess’s wife, but ends up falling for her lead suspect in Bradley’s second Swooning Virgins Society romance.

title: Talk Bookish to Me
author: Kate Bromley
description: A romance author must face the man who broke her heart when they are both invited to the same wedding—and his renewed presence in her life may be just the inspiration she needs. 75,000-copy announced first printing.

title: Rescue Me
author: Sarra Manning
description: Strangers Margot and Will fall in love first with the same shelter dog and then with each other as they learn to be doggy co-parents. 25,000-copy announced first printing

title: Life’s Too Short
author: Abby Jimenez
description: Carefree Vanessa Price’s wanderlust is curtailed when her sister saddles her with taking care of her niece for the foreseeable future. Luckily, help arrives in the form of a handsome, detail-oriented neighbor. 75,000-copy announced first printing.

title: The Dating Playbook
author: Farrah Rochon
description: follows The Boyfriend Project with the story of a down-on-her-luck personal trainer who agrees to help a former football star get back in shape for the NFL. 50,000-copy announced first printing.

title: Seven Days in June
author: Tia Williams
description: In this second-chance romance set in the world of New York’s “Black literati,” an erotica author reconnects with the literary powerhouse she once loved after 20 years apart. 60,000-copy announced first printing.

title: The Duke Heist
author: Erica Ridley
description: A con artist accidentally falls for her latest mark while pulling off her most personal crime to date, in the first Regency of Ridley’s Wild Wynchesters series, starred by PW.

title: The View Was Exhausting
author: Mikaella Clements and Onjuli Datta
description: Married duo Clements and Datta’s debut centers on the publicity relationship between an A-list actor of color and a white playboy—and the trip to the French Riviera that could change their relationship.

title: Accidentally Engaged
author: Farah Heron
description: To enter a couples cooking contest, Reena Manji recruits a fake fiancé: her gorgeous next-door neighbor and the same man her parents have been trying to set her up with. 50,000-copy announced first printing.

title: The Wedding Game
author: Meghan Quinn
description: pairs a DIY expert with a cynical divorce lawyer on the set of a wedding-themed reality TV show.

title: Club 42: A Choose-Your-Own Erotic Fantasy
author: Joanna Angel
description: Readers assume the role of Naomi and explore the world of a New York City strip club in this choose-your-own-adventure–style work of erotica.

title: Isabelle and Alexander
author: Rebecca Anderson
description: An arranged marriage evolves into a love match after a devastating accident forces the couple to grow closer in Anderson’s Victorian-era romance.

title: Masquerade
author: Anne Shade
description: In 1925, nightclub chorus girl Dinah helps Celine, a recent New Orleans transplant to Harlem, navigate a world of scandal, intrigue, and jazz.

title: Her Consigliere
author: Carsen Taite
description: A lawyer indebted to a mafia family falls for the undercover FBI agent determined to bring down their empire in this lesbian romantic suspense novel.

title: Shh... It’s Our Secret
author: Lizzie Chantree
description: delivers a contemporary romance about the timid proprietor of a small-town café bar whose well-kept secret could change the lives of her regulars.

title: Moments Like This (From Kona with Love)
author: Anna Gomez and Kristoffer Polaha
description: Heartbroken Andie Matthews moves to Hawaii, where she meets and starts a relationship with handsome Warren Yates—but Warren has a secret that threatens their romance.

title: Pride and Paranormal
author: Adrienne Blake
description: The struggling Bennet family of witches meet affluent warlock Fitz Darcy in Blake’s supernatural reimagining of Jane Austen’s Pride and Prejudice.

title: Hitched to the Gunslinger
author: Michelle McLean
description: combines rom-com and cowboy romance trends into a comic western featuring a dashing but unreliable gunslinger. 100,000-copy announced first printing.

title: Winner Takes All
author: Sandra Kitt
description: launches the Millionaire’s Club series, about couples who come into unexpected windfalls, with this interracial romance between a lottery presenter and the latest mega winner.

title: Noa and Lilah’s Guide to Surviving B-List Fame
author: Jennet Alexander
description: A scream queen with dreams of transcending her low-budget horror movie fame finds love with the female special effects artist working on her latest project.

title: Yes & I Love You
author: Roni Loren
description: An aspiring actor agrees to help a New Orleans media personality prepare for her onscreen debut and falls in love along the way in this standalone contemporary from Loren.

title: A Wolf in Duke’s Clothing
author: Susanna Allen
description: The kick-off of the Shape-Shifters of the Beau Monde paranormal Regency series sees a wolf-shifter duke searching for a mate during the London season.

title: The Gentleman’s Daughter
author: Bianca M. Schwarz
description: follows The Innkeepers Daughter with another Victorian-era work of romantic suspense, this time between an agent of the crown and an aspiring artist.

title: David and Ameena
author: Ami Rao
description: A chance meeting on a New York City subway sparks a romance between an American-Jewish musician and a British-Pakistani artist.

title: Prize Money
author: Celeste Castro
description: Toma, a female bullfighter, sweeps Eva, a barrel racer, off her feet in Castro’s rodeo-themed contemporary.

title: People We Meet on Vacation
author: Emily Henry
description: Best friends and travel buddies Poppy and Alex are polar opposites, but they don’t mind—until one of their annual summer vacations goes horribly wrong. Two years later, Poppy will do anything to save her relationship with the man she just might love.

title: No Words
author: Meg Cabot
description: Bestseller Cabot’s fourth Little Bridge Island romance reconciles a children’s author with the egotistical novelist she’s long considered her nemesis during the scenic island’s book festival.

title: A Lot Like Adiós
author: Alexis Daria
description: Daria follows You Had Me at Hola with a second-chance romance between reunited childhood best friends as they work together to open a gym in the Bronx.

title: Dating Dr. DIL
author: Nisha Sharma
description: puts a contemporary twist on The Taming of the Shrew with an enemies-to-lovers romance between a woman who needs to get engaged in a hurry and a relationship-phobic TV doctor.

title: All the Feels
author: Olivia Dade
description: follows Spoiler Alert with another fan-fiction infused rom-com, this time pairing a reckless TV star with the woman hired to keep him in line and out of the tabloids.

title: The Ex Hex
author: Erin Sterling
description: When modern witch Vivi Jones learns that the drunken hex she put on her ex-boyfriend caused more damage than she intended, the pair are forced to work together to break the curse.

title: Bombshell: A Hell’s Belles Novel
author: Sarah MacLean
description: The first in a Victorian romance series from bestseller MacLean sees scandalous Lady Sesily Talbot embracing her brazen reputation even as smitten Caleb Calhoun tries to keep her out of trouble.

title: The Donut Trap
author: Julie Tieu
description: Tieu’s debut follows a floundering young woman struggling to live up to parental expectations while working at her family’s donut shop and reconnecting with her college crush.
